page.title: 11MELROSE ABBEY
page.content: {Melrose Abbey}is arguably the finest of the Scottish{Border Abbeys.}The Abbey was founded in 1136 by monks from a{Cistercian}Abbey in Yorkshire. The convent ,being a major landowner, assumed an important role in both the religious and secular life in the Borders .The end came soon after the {Earl of Hertford's}invasion in 1545. By 1570 the crumbling ruins had become a handy stone-quarry for the local people.The{Abbey}started to open to the public in 1920.It is open all year round- from 9.30am till 4.00pm in the winter and from 9.30am till 7.00pm in the summer. For two days at Christmas and New Year it is closed.It is believed that{Robert the Bruce's heart is buried in the{graveyard}which surrounds{Melrose Abbey.
